metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9511 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to window size manipulation and stream prioritization manipulation, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker requests a large amount of data from a specified resource over multiple streams. They manipulate window size and stream priority to force the server to queue the data in 1-byte chunks. Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU, memory, or both.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnghttp2-14 - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2 - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-client - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-proxy - 1.39.2-1
nghttp2-server - 1.39.2-1
No subscription required

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-lua - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-common - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-core - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-extras - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-full - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
nginx-light - 1.16.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libnode64 - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
nodejs - 10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> nginx added http2 support in 1.9.5 nghttp2: nghttpd and nghttp are affected, libnghttp2 is not mdeslaur> nghttp2-server is in universe sahnaseredini> nodejs patch is a version upgrade

criterions.comment: nghttp2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.39.2-1').
nginx package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.1-0ubuntu1').
nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.19.0~dfsg-3ubuntu1').
